WorkItem.Description: I am running VS2012 Ver. 11.0.51106.01 update 1 on Windows server 2008. Installing from Microsoft download center is not installing in the extensions. I can install 0.8.2.0 but then turning around and installing 0.8.3 removes it from the extensions. Has anyone else had this happen and if so were they able to work around this.

Comments.Message:
Can you re-open and post the installer log file (probably from both the 0.8.2 and 0.8.3 installers)? Thanks!

** Closed by RyanCavanaugh 03/18/2013 11:06AM

I have attached the VSIX installer log for 0.8.2.0. I have not found any installation logs locally on my machine. There is no VSIX installer log for 0.8.3.0. If you have a suggestion where to find the installation logs I'd appreciate it. They are not in my user temp files.

Unfortunately the VSIX logs will not be very helpful, we'll really need the full MSI logs. It should the most recent (or one of the most recent) *.txt or *.log files in %temp% if you've just tried to install it. Please reopen again if you're able to get them.

Are you running Windows Server 2008 or 2008 R2? Note the former isn't a supported platform for VS2012 (http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/eng/products/compatibility).
